CjET0o4GXhjEv2UFj14WPg.text: Food was ok, waitress ruined it by dumping a glass of water on one of our party, with a few other close calls and miscues.

TF6MNn2ofK71s0kAqgVcbQ.text: We were in town for a dance convention and found this gem. Great ambience and very pleasant staff. The food was delicious. I had the Mama Mia. The eggplant was crispy and the tomato sauce delicious. They used just the right amount of cheese. My daughter had the pasta with meatballs. It was really tasty and a great portion for a kids. My non-vegetarian son had the chili and he loved it. Great place!

TwnZuPg9StDqn3_7N84mSg.text: Mike the manager was the best service ever!  The food here is average but the service was outstanding.   For a vegan place, I don't think I would drive 20 minutes out of our way to try the food but we would come back because Mike is soooo nice and funny.   Average food, with awesome manager! Extra star for the nice experience.

Au5zC8eEcSuWTu7AV1XbxA.text: I've been here about 4 times. The food is always good. I really like it and that's why I keep going back. I've had the pancakes, good day burrito, texas hold em, and the country classic. They were all delish! My kiddo likes the mac and cheese and the lentil soup as well as the mashed potatoes and gravy. Hubby likes the Philly.  The servers are very nice but sometimes they are forgetful or just inexperienced. Be sure to order your child's food first so it comes out first. It happened to us once and other parents say the same thing - sometimes they bring out the adults' food and make the kids wait, which is a huge no-no in food service. But all the servers are really nice and they seem to like kids. There's also a few kids toys and things to do on the community bookshelf in the corner.  They deliver too. I can't review that aspect because I live outside the delivery boundaries but that's kind of cool that they deliver.  On thing - I feel like if they're going to be open for breakfast on weekdays then they should open at 6 or 7am for people who work. Instead, they open at 9. It's just kind of weird. I would expect a place like that to open at 10 or 11 on weekdays and then offer a Sunday brunch. But what they do is they serve breakfast from 9-11:30 and then lunch at 11-5pm (and then dinner). It's just odd to me. If you go out with a group at 10 or 11am you might want to do brunch, not just breakfast. And if you roll in at 12pm you might still want some breakfast foods. I just think brunch makes a lot more sense, but whatever, that's not a deal-breaker.  Again, the food is awesome.

u464AmOJvgbx-icRYoxs1A.text: It gets 2 stars because I like the food. I came in and ordered the bubba ke bubba appetizer and a couple items to go. It's now been 45 minutes and I still don't have my appetizer or the to go items.   There are exactly 6 tables in the restaurant and people that got here 10 minutes after me just got their food.  This just happened and thy have now lost a star. So one star it is and i guess I'm not eating lunch today.

I ordered the Philly cheese and it was better than expected. I've also had the eggs here and they were ok. Compliments to the chef

QjMNCkKPkirxo5R22i9S4A.text: This is vegan organic food,  not junk fast food.    Violette's Vegan Organic Eatery was one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.   I ordered the Samurai burger with a chocolotta shake.   When I was looking at the menu I saw that the Samurai burger came with stir fry veggies AND fries which I thought sounded strange together.  It was fantastic! The server was very nice,  I loved the colors and decor.   Not a single complaint!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Samurai burger, stir fry veggies, fries and chocolotta shake. All vegan!  :)

-L2jE5AeDa_0quCVosX96w.text: If you like to eat tasty and healthy food, this is the place to go.    I was very skeptical in eating vegan food until I tried this place out.  My favorite entrees are the curry bowl and trio taco bowl and teriyaki wrap and the samurai burger.    Their desserts are to die for as well.  Triple chocolate cake hits the spot for me every single time.     So glad they started to serve breakfast now.  My goal is to taste every single dish they offer in the restaurant :)

cInAW01y5dNVyEfwD7vIAQ.text: My fiance and I came to Violettes Vegan expecting the same feel as all the other vegan finds in Vegas, an "OK" place with a few suggestions of how they could make the food more flavorful.  "OK" is an understatement for the experience we had.   The menu is absolutely vegan, so there is a complete sense of relief that there are no hidden food agendas to enhance the taste.   The next order of stress for the Vegan is, "Is this going to be a squirrel portion of gerbil flavored food?" Every single thing we ordered was delicious and well porportioned; not too much food and not too little. To quote goldie locks it was "Just RIGHT!" Yes I know this is a cheesy (but vegan cheesy) read!   The ambiance is also a 10 with friendly service, whimsical paintings, friendly and attentive staff, and books everywhere for the guest to enjoy at their table. They make fresh smoothies and their desserts are set adorably on display; believe me they are as moist & tasty as they look!  The only tip of advice I would suggest for the staff is to have their menus revised for grammatical errors, and choice of words as sometimes the clarifications on things like 'cheese' V.S. cheese was a bit confusing. But once we were told by the server that despite what the menu says, all of it is dairy/egg/animal free, this became the last thing we were focused on as we were enjoying all the goods!   We had an overwhelmingly positive experience here. We've been to several vegan friendly themed restaurants here in town, and this one stood out amongst the rest. Treat yourself to a slice of cake! You won't be disappointed. :) :)

HCVXfwg2VGHLvpuJJT9Xmw.text: First time customer. Great food. I recommend it highly.   Lots of variety. Creative menu. Might turn off those with inflexible and limited palates. But my wife and I loved the variety. Plenty to non conventional burger choices.   Main reason we chose it is because the quality of food. All organic. Sure it costs more but well worth it. You can feel the difference in the taste. Imagine top quality food that tastes exceptional. Unbeatable combination. Of course, we love shopping at Whole Foods and love Organic Foods to begin with so perhaps we are biased. It's easy to get used to the run of the mill food. Rare to find a restaurant committed to real quality. Most of the restaurants that make that commitment don't seem to be able to make a profit and go out of business. I sure hope that doesn't happen with this one.   We loved their fresh vegetable juice blends. They are a meal in and by themselves.   We indulged in the lemon coconut cake. So smooth. It was well worth it. Delicious. I would go back just for that treat alone.   We are also impressed with the decor. Great blend of bright colors. The art hanging on the wall was certainly a conversation piece.   Even if you're not a vegetarian it is well worth visiting. Open your mind and your taste buds and you will be pleasantly surprised. The experience made us give serious consideration to becoming committed vegetarians.

B73dTFnAhWR8RaNSWfO3YA.text: This is a great spot for vegan/organic/non-gmo eats here in vegas. Coming from Seattle, I have found the vegan/vegetarian options are very limited in this city. This spot is a cute little gem and the perfect place for anyone who is conscious about where their food comes from.  The food is great; however, I do feel like the service could have been better. Our waitress was very nice but I had to consistently ask her for things because she kept on forgetting (forgot to bring us a smoothie menu, had to ask twice). Other than that, it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hippie chick &#34;burger&#34; with fries - the fries were my favorite!!
Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hummus plate.

IZXrHPgTmrMO_1YXUjJOzQ.text: Food was so good, wish it was all over the place. The great service and music was a great added bonus!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for our delicious FOOD!

MR4iQCldqg3WqFqLI0y-uw.text: This place is very special to me not just because of the great tasting vegan cuisine, but also the way they make you feel like family. I have enjoyed eating here for years and am honored to be considered a regular.

nNoW2KGtD8QuoL4abz3YTA.text: This place is by far one of my favorite vegan places in town! Uggghh everything I try is so good. I crave it all the time. Since discovering this place two weeks ago I have eaten here about five times. I definitely recommend coming down here with your bf or bff and just splurge. Did this with a friend last week. We got: the biscuits & gravy, corn salad, mac & cheese, sassy wings, and chocolate cake, and still had a lot of left overs. Great for breakfast or late night snack ;) (the food reheats really well and I could argue it tastes even better). The prices are right with hearty portions, we split the check and only paid $20 each! Great place, great food, great atmosphere, great people.

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate cake; a hearty slice of moist cake with thick and rich fudge like filling and icing.

R3b_X_xYv2YN9IRfJ092UA.text: Hands down my favorite place to eat vegan food. The service is always very good and the food is just wow. If you're going to eat here you have to try the wings, or anything it's all good. Love it!!!

nz1X0bg5_2gMKeore6eW7Q.text: So yummy, free chili when you check in, goes amazing with the nachos!! Came from California for EDC and I'm so happy I came across this place. My boyfriend isn't vegetarian/vegan but he loves the nachos with chili.

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CJQ4kRKEUkdJd6AfwGD2pg.text: The past few times I've been to this location I've received very good service. The ambiance is inviting, the prices are reasonable, but the food is not A+.   -Red rock nachos ARE tasty, yet portions were way off the last time I went. For the price of the nachos, I'm hoping they adjusted those portions.   -Red rockin' chili is very good, and could possibly pass as a meat dish! Worth it.  -Sunrise superman should not be listed on the menu as a "bacon" substitute. It doesn't taste like bacon. As a matter of fact did not have any notably tasty flavors at all. Pass.  -Positively pad Thai was too sweet and also thick and grainy in texture. Pass.  Although I had a couple dishes I didn't love, I will be returning to try out other dishes from the menu!

rl9uSTLz8WsOO5qL-l31jA.text: So I was really excited to try this place as a fellow vegan. I came in with a friend and she had a coffee which was better than average and I stuck with water. I got the biscuits and gravy and she got BLT. With potatoes. After asking multiple times for cream for coffee they brought it out with the food. My friend's food was cold and not made correctly and My biscuits were hard and cold and the gravy had a nice flavor but was cold as well. It tasted like it was left out and reheated from a past meal. I originally ordered fruit as a side but they came to tell me as they brought me the food that they didn't have any. How do u not have fruit??!!  But they did have some sitting out for smoothies I guess that fruit was reserved.  All in all , poor customer service, poorly heated and unfresh food. But good decor and good coffee. Is it worth coming back? U tell me. I didn't have any smoothies maybe those make up for everything else.

sYswsBTscczy08CYrnZDtQ.text: The food is really delicious, but the service was subpar.... in particular our waitress who could not focus on her job. We had to ask multiple times for silverware, coffee, sugar, hot sauce.... looked like the other staff were good, just not our waitress.

dF6u6OpBuK94eLvB3Q-xvQ.text: Food is always delicious, definitely my favorite vegan spot in town.  The menu has variety and the portions are fairly big. Definitely the place to go if your feeling nostalgic and craving something from before you went vegan. The service is good, everyone I've had as a server has been really nice and attentive. My favorites include the California dreaming burger, the sassy wings, the southern comfort, and the date me smoothie.

9t5iuPcZPy37LzDuamV93A.text: I've been here many times and the food is always delicious, I'm very picky so that is saying a lot!   Ive ordered the chili almost every time I go, great flavor and very filling. I had creamy potato soup today which was so good! I wish it was permanently on the menu.  I love the zucchini sticks and the fries, idk why but vegan places always have the best fries. Bf loves all the sandwiches and burgers.  Everything you order will be amazing, but what I really love about this place is how colorful and relaxing it is. They play great music and have beautiful artwork everywhere. Servers are also very friendly!  UPDATE: they added potato skins and they are to die for!!!

xoFHRyXjXkUyM9wxDvBxIw.text: I've been twice and will be back. Great vegan sandwiches and apps, great service.  To be critical, I think it's a little bright in there, and the shakes might need some work. But, the books on the shelves and the card games, and the fantastic servers and good food make me look forward to coming back!

SjHmVTVrXhCzP15gcLUrWQ.text: The food here is delicious!! We ordered the sassy wings and the backyard barbeque. The wings were delicious but pretty spicy. The backyard barbeque sandwich was OUTSTANDING. I highly recommend the sandwich! We also got the black bean and potato salads as sides. The potato salad was okay, but the black bean salad was PERFECT. Choose the black bean salad if you're debating between the two options.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is also awesome. The walls are colorful with gorgeous artwork. The general manager is extremely friendly and attentive. Overall we had an awesome experience and will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sassy wings :) it comes with 6 pieces (we ate half already)

6O_u81fumGklEWCrkPuqrg.text: I wanted to write an update:  First off, I'm very glad that the owner reads the reviews and that she took the time to respond to my mine. I've been back dozens of times since as I love the food. I do have a few more observations to share.   Customer service does not seem to improve. I notice new employees every time I come so I assume that the turn over is pretty high. Most of the girls are not knowledgable and move Very slowly.  I was in with a girlfriend of mine a few weeks ago and we couldn't even get utensils even after the food dropped. No one paid attention to us. After I got up and asked for some I got a weird vibe about it. No ones comes by later to check on tables, at least this is what my perception was.   Last week I was dining at the bar and a woman came, new to the place, and asked for a to go menu. The girls handed her a business card. I would at least attempt to say something like "we are paper free here, please visit us online to see a full menu". The lady then took a dine-in menu and perused through. Finally, she hails one of the serves and said that she is ready to order. The two girls either didn't hear or they ignored her. She was becoming antsy and it was obvious she needed assistance. A server walked by her to look after guests who came in after her and she had to stop the girl in her path and explain she was asking for help, with a bit of frustration. The server's answer was "oh... Okay." No apology or enthusiasm. Yikes.   On to me:  Last week I had stopped in three times. Once to pick up a 16oz drink-- I was given the smallest container I've ever seen. I am pretty certain that was not 16 oz. it looked more like 8oz. Starbucks grande cup is 16oz and what I got was half of that. I think the very Least a server should know are the serving sizes so that customers are not wasting their money. The Castaway smoothie was delicious though. Really awesome stuff. I did a small spoon of peanut butter instead of almond and it was excellent.   Second time that week I had a dinner special, I think. It was the Hippy Chick burger and it came with warm seasoned kale and a side of potato mash with gravy. This was absolutely incredible. My burger lacked mayo but I added some ketchup to it and it was great. I ate it with a side of cole slaw, which was also amazing but very Extra creamy. It was swimming in liquidy mayo. It was delicious but too creamy for me. I then ate the kale and mash together. I have to say this was probably the best potato mash I've ever had (other than the "real" stuff I make with butter and half&half). The kale was amazing with it, although a pinch too salty.   This was literally two meals in one and I was beyond satisfied.   On my third visit I had the falafel pita with cole slaw and a side of fries. The pita itself was absolutely incredible. I loved the texture. I am not sure if it's gluten free but it certainly was Awesome. Other than this, the dish was very bland. The falafels have an excellent potential but were seriously under seasoned; also there were still half bits of chickpeas in them. I'm not sure if this is done on purpose. The mix could have used a lot more cumin, salt and pepper. They were also very crunchy on the outside but not in a good way. They were tiny bits of something that for me, makes me fear I'll chip a tooth. If a little more TLC was put into the preparation, the falafel would have been amazing.   The hummus inside my pita was flavorless. Literally, it was just blended chickpeas. There was no salt, no pepper, I could not taste tahini in it nor lemon juice.  I asked for tahini in my pita and tzatziki on the side. I did not taste any tahini in there. You can't miss it, it's a very earthy distinct taste. I guess they forgot to tell the chef. Also, a stuffed pita without onions is like milk without a cookie. The flavor profile was seriously undermined with that omission.   I had to put a ton of pepper and a bit of salt to pump flavor into this dish. I also added a squeeze of lemon juice. These three things alone elevated the dish to another level.   My fabulous fries came out without seasoning. I also had to add salt and pepper to them. The cole slaw was perfect amount of creamy and well, that's about it. No salt, nada. I added lemon to it to which helped immediately.   I feel the chef who worked that day absolutely despises seasoning because everything was so bland and flavorless.   I have to say that a $10 dish, where a customer gets 3 falafels and a bland experience, is overpriced. Across the way, Sababa's makes a Killer falafel sandwich with the Works for like $8.   Side note: I sat at the bar for an hour and half looking at a dirty table to my left. It was cleaned up right before I left. There were other tables that weren't bussed but this one was a mess for quite a long time.   I'll keep coming here because I love the food. I know that in this business we all strive to improve and be better & training our staff to be more observant and in charge is key.

BfYMOSamGGtGmCdbL89eRQ.text: Brief Overview: This is a great organic and Non-GMO restaurant that combines the foods you've known and loved growing up, just in a vegan version.  Pros: - Their regular/baked cheese cake is so good that I savor every bite (I can't even tell it's vegan) - Their waffles and pancakes are absolutely delicious (I leave feeling happy) - The food is top notch and the owner Cindy is such a kind and giving woman (love her to death) :-) - They let me teach essential oil classes every Saturday at this location so they are definitely into health and wellness!  Cons: - The noise level can be a little loud with the blender and smoothie going at times (hard to hear conversations) - Some food items could use a little more flavor like the hummus (but they are still tasty)  Final Verdict: - This is a must-visit location if you are a local or if you are visiting Las Vegas. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas and there's a reason why I go here every week (it's so awesome!) :-)

Owj4c3ImioN5H9bi0BokLA.text: Went here for my birthday get together and was really blown away! I had the "beef and broccoli" which had a great texture, flavor, and was cooked in a lovely creamy garlic sauce. My wife had the burrito from the entres portion of the menu and she really enjoyed that as well.  Super great vibe, beautiful art on the walls, and great service!

Nf-Gs9xnwx0lxSDg0AJtUQ.text: Thank you, Cindy for your quick response & caring energy. We will gladly be coming back. Looking forward to trying the teriyaki bites.

-JHfL-9O6LGKeRTERhhHyA.text: Great service and the best BLT ever can't wait to go back!  The staff was super helpful, the sandwich was just lightly toasted, BTW it's vegan

wLio5ZcU30xIcuvEfISAkQ.text: I ordered the Pad Thai and it should've been called peanut butter pad Thai. Boy did it taste like a lot of peanut butter. The portion size was good and the staff was very friendly, I'm just not sure I was in the mood for an expensive bowl of peanut butter. I'm not sure I'll go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter drenched pad Thai. Not sure that I like the taste of peanut butter enough to drench it all over my vegetables.

QQ4Yjdq2Yc69zAqgastiSg.text: Love that they open early and is one of the only places in Vegas for a vegan breakfast. Diverse menu, relaxing music and friendly staff make this a great place for vegan meals in Vegas

Ks3vFg1UoCn-JbbCssozoQ.text: Delicious food, great service & atmosphere.....Even the ladies room is tranquil.....Motown music is awesome.....This restaurant is absolutely devine and the owner:Michael is wonderful.....Genuine New Yorker:Bronx

aZwwl1piP6IwwCy9xqCkhQ.text: Oh my goodness Violette's Handcrafted Organic Iced Tea is so delicious; seriously it's one of the best. I also had the Fabulous French Fries and I never had anything cooked in rice bran oil- I wonder if the type of oil used makes them crispy? I tried one of the big noodles in the Violette's Mac N' Cheeze and it was really creamy. I saved the Lemon Scampi for later and had it for dinner; it was still good and very healthy. There's a lot of variety in the menu and that's a good thing I really recommend this restaurant but oh my goodness if you go try the tea.

JY2Fz7gMmMhK7H9yCZVJ3g.text: Being newly Vegan I didn't know what to expect here, but I've only heard good things about them from my employees at work. So I figured I'd take my wife there for a date night! We were blown away by their great customer service( from the girl with the black dreds ) and by the quality and flavor of their food! Mike T took really good care of us as well by making sure we enjoyed everything we ordered! I ordered the Hippie Chick Burger which was freaking awesome! The hemp pesto and kale set it off! And I got a side of fries covered in gravy which was awesome! Also we ordered an appetizer of Sassy wings! You have to try these! Its a must! My wife ordered the Beef and Broccoli with corn bread! I tried a sample of her's ;) and have to say it was great as well! This will definitely be our new little spot! The atmosphere at this place was very calm and friendly! And I love the chimes when you open the door! I will definitely be back soon! I haven't tried their juice/smoothie bar yet, but that will be next!

yis9WEojjKUvpISOR0J2EQ.text: I was happy to see this spot show up on yelp because I feel that there aren't enough vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Vegas. I've been sick in bed so I ordered over the phone and had my boyfriend pick it up. I ordered the samurai burger platter, the raw cheesecake, and the castaway smoothie. The lady I spoke to made the cheesecake sound convincing and mentioned that there is fresh fruit on top. My boyfriend brought me the food and there was no smoothie. I ate the burger and it was actually delicious. I don't eat red meat anymore so it was nice to have an alternative. It came with fries that were soggy, and a bit oily. I open the box of raw cheesecake and it seems melted and had no fresh fruit on it. I ate it anyways, and to my surprise, it was really yummy. I called to complain about the service and also mention that the food was really good (lol) while my boyfriend went to grab my smoothie. When he came back he told me that they made it fresh so I take a sip and it isn't very cold. It was closer to room temperature but the flavor was good. I just wish it was cold. They gave him a 10% off card for next time which was a nice gesture, but the service needs to be improved. I do have to say that they have a lot of potential considering that the food is delicious but they just need more accurate service even for to go orders. I want to go here again, but I just hope the service is better next time.

qlWlkm-ZMKvgmImx2IIN2g.text: I am not Vegan.  I am not even vegetarian.  Went to dinner at VV last night for a friend's birthday celebration.  And the service, food and atmosphere was so lovely I wanted to take a moment and recommend this place to others.  My children and I felt as comfortable as we would in our own home.  Beautiful experience in every way.  Please support this restaurant.  Good people sharing good food doing good things.  Thank you, Cyndy, Mark and Giovanna.  Best in all things.

yGgYUXTZq0mQC5amXL9UoA.text: I would like to give this place a better review, I eat here very frequently because I just moved to vegas and it's conveniently located right across the street from my house and It's organic and vegan. However the service is hit or miss depending on who is working and the food is the same sometimes good sometimes the complete opposite. I keep coming because of convenience but other wise I would spend my money else where. Today I came in to order an $7.95 shake only to recieve a child's size cup of something that didn't taste nor was it the size I usually recieve when I ask the server if the sizes changed she rudely hands me the menu and tells me to reference the sizes. I'm in here everyday and still no one has asked my name and they act like they've never seen me before. I would suggest finding another place in vegas to spend your money. I'm going to hunt for better service and better quality even if I have to drive further.

_UqbjGpc8ddVm8AfM-WtLg.text: I love this place! The food is amazing and organic!  I've never been in a more beautiful breakfast restaurant. Great vibes, great food, great location.

AOHcmtVuI_kQ0YKMF61ZRw.text: Absolutely adore it. Placed a to go order, the owner came and lit a candle for my table and brought me a complimentary water. Staff is adorable! Great atmosphere and such cute names for their menu items.

mw5Pt2BiHO2wwFbLpIZrcg.text: The atmosphere and food here are wonderful. Prices are great and the staff is friendly! The only thing that prevents me from giving 5 stars is the service being slow. It seems they aren't staffed enough for the amount of guests in the restaurant at any given time. That being said, the restaurant isn't even half full, but the servers take a while to get to your table and the food takes no less than 30 min to come out. This was my second time here. I will definitely be back, just don't have any prior commitments you have to be at near the time you come.

gMfRQLQj5DitiWcL0OpQkA.text: slow service, a little pricy,  food good, was the right temperature.  did not have the ravishing red.pepper soup ready for Valentines Day, was after 5pm, suppose to be ready by 4.  have been here once before, probably will stik with my homemade organic foods

EOxI9Cnl02WSYnTMunp9Sw.text: I wanted a healthy meal. Choices are limited. You know, let me try Violettes again. Perhaps they have ironed out some or all of the issues, I previously reported. I am happy to write that my first trip back in quite some time, was a big success. As usual, you are greeted by one of the cheerful staff. I then checked out the new, updated menu. Glad to see my favorite lentil burger remained.. A delicious bite that exudes health. The bean/corn salad remains tasty. I could eat a gallon. I had a simple salad with a chipotle lime dressing. Like all the ingredients here, the salad has the freshest of ingredients. Lettuce has that lovely crispiness that makes it good. The dressing has a kick. I mean that in a good way. There were perhaps a few too many chick peas for my taste. The coconut cake was ok, the everything cookie outstanding. Make sure you get their apple pie, which is the best tasting dish on the menu and among the best pieces of pie, I have EVER eaten. Many of my complaints from a prior review were fixed. I did not order any juice, but I can tell you, I saw to go covers. I am optimistic about my next visit. Healthy meals make for a better day. Violettes is a go to place to do just that. Like many new businesses, kinks need to be ironed out.  Violettes has done just that. I strongly recommend you give it a try, whether you are vegan or not.

Q9V7KoKQFcVhgsJ-a-9vkg.text: worse service EVER ! Gave me a dirty cup with no straw , had to get up and ask for it . Asked the server what was good on the menu and she said she doesn't know and hasn't tried anything . We ordered smoothies to start and after 20 minutes server walks up to say they dont have one of the ingredients to make it . After 10 minutes comes up to let me know they don't have the juice for my smoothie . After another long wait , our food comes out . They did not bring any silverware or napkins . Waited a couple minutes and then just got up and asked for some myself . Were not asked if we wanted ketchup or anything with our fries and were not checked on again . Had a friend join in and she asked for hot coffee . Server says okay and goes to the back and then walks up after 5 minutes and says they only serve cold coffee . My friend agrees to the cold coffee and was just waiting . Around another 5 minutes pass and our server comes back to tell us the coffee machine is broken . Both servers working looked miserable and did not smile once , and one server looked to have poor hygiene so you're almost scared if she gets too close to your food . Overall , this lunch experience was 2 hours long for one sandwich and two smoothies . So if you plan on going in , eat right before you do because by the time it all comes out , it's time for your next meal in the day . As for the food , i couldn't complain . It's the service that i dont plan on going back for

2-aoHBbmJ6CorUiRARvvBw.text: Wow, our family is in love with Violette's.  We make a point of visiting local vegan when we travel and yesterday we drove to Vegas for an event and decided to check out the local vegan joints.  Violette's had solid reviews on HappyC, and my family (4) went for dinner Friday night.  The cheeseburger was the best homemade veggie burger not anything like a Boca or Beyond Burger.  The fries were THE BEST golden brown ohhh I'm relieving the taste!!!! Let me go on...the steak seitan and broccoli mashed potatoes and mushrooms and gravy. The portions were large and good value. My kids are kind of picky and they both commented how good the food was (rarely stated like that).  Then we went back the next day for lunch before heading out of town.  Ohhhj I'm Getting flashbacks about the lunch.  I had to tell the staff several times how great everything was.  They were all very attentive and mellow with focus on the job unlike many of my home restaurants in Orange Cty. . Honestly is it okay to say we had food orgasms at Violette's ????!!! We did!!! Thank You!! I'm not sorry to say Violette's would be a major reason for us to go to Vegas for more than the Strip.

Vi1p9oFWwMG45jJpWvJh4g.text: Finally got to try this place out for a Saturday lunch! My bf & I have been on the hunt for some good vegan-friendly restaurants. This is definitely now on our list of favorite vegan places in Vegas!   It's a "seat yourself" type of restaurant and our server told us about the breakfast and brunch menu since it was our first time. We each got a free coffee when you purchase an entree (love how they serve fresh "Desert Wind Coffee Roasters" & support local business since that's my favorite coffee shop in town!) which comes with almond milk and brown sugar as the sweetener.  As our appetizer, we checked in to get a free Red Rockin Chili - which was great and tasted like regular chili! It comes in a huge bowl which was good enough for us to share.   For our entrees, we decided to go with the Hippie Chick Burger with a side of French fries and the make your own tofu scramble with tempeh bacon, brown rice, and a side of pancakes.   OH MAN. The burger was super tasty and probably the best vegan burger I've had so far! I think what really brought out the flavors was the pesto that was in it - so yummy and a serious must try! 5/5 for sure!   My bf really enjoyed the tofu scramble because the tempeh bacon was DELICIOUS! It was so flavorful and even better than regular bacon. 5/5 as well!   We were so full but decided to get the vegan donuts to go; they have a little display of their vegan desserts and they all looked delicious! Definitely looking forward to trying those for next time.  Overall we had a great first time experience and though it is a bit pricey, we can't wait for the next time we go!   Even if you aren't vegan, we truly recommend to try this place out in the future!

tJ1Y8SvtVQbklVmRAo-OYg.text: Super bomb! I really enjoyed the experience. Cozy little spot with good energy. I really enjoyed the biscuits and gravy and my girl got the gluten free blueberry pancakes. LA FLAME!   The service was very swift. Was in a rush to make an appointment to get a tire replaced and I didn't even have to mention it and they took care of us.   PS. Do yourself a favor and get the Vegas Sunrise juice. 'Twas on point!  BLESS!

QiWYworod8KVW3vz4PLQhg.text: I love this place, they usually have slower service but it's a great place for kids and family, the food is really good, and the place has a great vibe! I always go to Violette s and the baked goods are really well done!  Prob my fav vegan place so far!! I have only been to a few in vegas and I love it here!

0WYUzNMIpikKEHrkSjz7-A.text: Best Vegan restaurant ive been to since my stay in Vegas. I make sure to grab enough food for the entire day just because it makes my life that much more deliciously simple. Im glad the the menus items arent set in stone and they are willing to make subtle changes. Im a huge fan of the chilli cheese fries and the burgers. It's rare that i find vegan and gluten free options like these. Im going to miss this place when I leave.

6zee-ddymD-NcdkUYXRh4Q.text: I've recently went "vegan" or attempted to.  The food is good and they have a wide variety on their menu.  It's hard for me to give vegan places 5 stars when I know that there are other vegan places that have better food.  The service was also extremely slow, it took a while for us to get our menu & we waited about 10 minutes before our order was taken.  Lastly the follow up on how the food was, was absent from our experience.  If you want decent vegan food on the westside this will be the best closest thing.

8y1kM8bqBFPV0Qtc2Nra3A.text: Just wanted to update a previous bad review. The business owner reached out to me and apologized for my not-so-five-star experience. I appreciate that management cares for their customers and values their business enough to take the time to write a personalized message. I will be returning to Violette's soon. The food is a vegan dream and always deserves 5 stars.

UfrkjJZiw_SEs9caSxUoiQ.text: Atmosphere is so warm & cool! They have oracle cards on the table which is so fun & something to do while waiting for your food. The menu is so amazing, so many options. Everything is fresh & delicious. We got the "good morning tacos" & the breakfast burrito! Both super good!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful breakfast :) super delicious

redvmXdy7K7K4JaQzoxUew.text: 3 1/2 stars, really. Potato Salad.  Potato Salad. POTATO SALAD! This is my way of expressing just how much I LOVE their potato salad, which made me give them 4 stars instead of 3. Coming from Missouri, which has very "southern" roots and ways, I love a creamy, mayo-based potato salad, but had not been able to find a good one since becoming vegan.  The search is over. As I ate my potato salad in my car, I contemplated going back to ask for the rest of their pot, tupperware bowl, etc. I need this in bulk! (They should sell it at Sam's or Costco!) Moving on...  I also got 2 orders of the Sassy Wings, but one order was buffalo sauce only. While the flavor of the sauce was very good, I wasn't a huge fan of the texture of their wings; they were too thick.  I prefer a thinner, less "faux-meaty" consistency. They were just ok, to me.  I ordered a side of their Fabulous Fries, which were excellent in flavor/seasoning.    I also got their Country Classic, which, per the menu, comes with crispy tempeh & tofu cutlets (1 of each), collard greens,mashed potatoes, and cornbread. Sounds like a proper southern meal. However, to my dismay, I ended up with a cauliflower, broccoli, and carrot medley instead of the promised greens. (I had hot sauce in my bag for those greens!) I didn't like the cornbread or the cutlets. I was disappointed, to say the least. The mashed potatoes were good though.   The carrot cake that I ordered was delicious.  I was supposed to get a free Red Rockin' Chili with my Yelp check-in, and she even marked it as "Used" on my app, however, it was MIA from my to-go bag.   I may not have had the best experience with all of the food I ordered, but I still really like this place. The vibe was mellow, light auras, friendly worker, clean and welcoming environment, and the prices are fair. It's in a strip mall, so there is plenty of parking, and there is signage everywhere... On each corner for each intersecting street and on the front and back of the building, which was extremely helpful for me as I was looking for it. I will be back to try other menu items, and of course, for more tater salad.

hBeXho_PAWaTWp1NGsEeiQ.text: Seriously the best place ever! Took all my non vegan friends here and they loved it. I am here almost everyday, 4-5 x a week!!!!!

SX8R5c02QbuBbwbzU9bI_g.text: I've been to violets about 5 times now. The first time I didn't have a great experience, but it wasn't their fault. I had a wheat gluten meatball sub which was delicious but it kept me bloated for about 4 days. But again I didn't know that I was gluten intolerant until that day. But that didn't deter me, I've been back four other times, each time I have avoided gluten. I've had tofu dishes, tempeh, etc and everything has been super delicious. The veggie mac and cheese is amazing, you'd be surprised to know that there was no milk. The buffalo chicken sandwich which is fried tofu with buffalo sauce and all the fixings is delicious. The Orange juice is amazing and I just had their tofu scramble for brunch this morning and I was quite impressed. I'm new to this whole vegan thing and I guess my point is to be careful what you eat if you're just starting out because you don't want what happened to me to happen to you. The great thing is that they have amazing options and everything has been delicious. It's a little bit pricey but you would expect that for high quality food and organic ingredients.

_bwjkJ0tzUMcmxrPToOArQ.text: Had a food poisoning at this place twice :( Gave this place several chances but no luck.  Smoothies are great, desserts are too way sweet (I mean the crust is all about the sugar; I had a carrot cake). The place is well designed, clean and tidy. However health is more important than tasteful paintings on the wall.

V7Ui1CbCJfXwKF8AGx2wOQ.text: Came from across town and the food was worth the drive! Fresh and delicious, the ppl were super nice and the atmosphere was great. They also have some good reads while you wait. Definitely will be back for more!

rQIJH8llhDxyWYp8VPZpGQ.text: I visited Las Vegas last week. I had done my research about vegan restaurants in the city before so I picked up this vegan restaurant to have lunch. I ordered a Zen Zinger drink and a cheese burger. My drink was very refreshing and my cheese burger the best vegan burger I've eaten. I fell in love with this nice place. The employees are very friendly and energetic. You can feel the good vibes there. Special thanks to James who took care of me and David the manager. I went again the following day and I ate the best vegan nachos.  I will go to eat to Violette's it every time I stop in Las Vegas in the future.

JwyBLOZbbJ7nBd84O12fww.text: My family and I came to this place during a few months back (March) and I've been meaning to write this review ever since lol.   The place is really cool. Great parking, and a lot of space for larger parties (6 or more people).   The night we went, they had live music and had the lights going outside for some great ambiance.   Beyond that, and what you're really here for, the food...  The food was really, really good. I was a little worried at first because my wife and I prefer restaurants that specialize in a certain genre. However, everything we ordered was very tasty. My son loved his food too.   We shared a buffalo cauliflower as the app, very great flavor and sauce. For our main entrees we both had salads, they were huge, so beware if you're considering one. I will say, the caesar salad was a little underwhelming, nothing spectacular and definitely nothing I would order again. My son had the kids Mac n Cheese. That was very tasty, and something I would order again lol.   The only knock, besides the salad, was the service. Our server was nice, but they were under staffed so things took a while. It's hard to have patience though with an unpredictable toddler.   All in all, I would definitely come here again, no question.

NI2OXQoyIR6iW6fcRBr1LA.text: Quintessential Vegan Superpower For Your Clean-Mean-Alkalinized Lifestyle and the DADs (Days After Debauchery) ****Excellent in my non-professional opinion, for gluten-free, grain-free, Low-FODMAP and macrobiotic adherents, for those with various intolerances and allergies and compromised health****  Thanks to fellow Yelpaholics, I had lunch here with family members while we were on a sedate vacay around New Year's 2018. I'll bet you $100 I'll come back the next time I'm in Vegas, and every time thereafter, even more so than the foodie destinations here most popular with the masses.  Atmosphere:  Casual, phenomenally positive vibes from the plant-based sustenance. Pretty pastel colors on the walls, embrace-the-sexiness-within-you posters and wall decor, soul-boosting books from various cultures and blended faiths to peruse and delight and get you on your way to a most pleasant day. Clean, bright, airy, cheerful, no guilt, cruelty-free! More on the books and other: Earth-embracing, female strength, human solidarity, no-more-wars ever grooviness, yet not too idealistic, for your supreme higher self!!! The friendliest, genuinely radiant and helpful staff who really seem to love being here and serving you. It sounds like I'm crazy-high on life writing this, and I am.   Food:  Just a few standouts were the perfectly crispy and damnnn, so flavorful cauliflower with the unusually seasoned Teriyaki sauce. You have to get this!! My wheatgrass was obviously made with grass blades plucked at the ideal time for juicing, as just by the taste, this was better than most wheatgrass shots I've ever had. A bit of liver-lovin' bitterness cut with a hug-you sweetness. I believe it was the non-soy (I TOTally avoid soy products unless they are fermented, for optimum thyroid, hormone, immune system, and gut functioning; plus 90% or more of U.S. soy is GMO) burger I ordered. I didn't miss the meat one bit and probably, neither will even many die-hard carnivores. This burger was of a far higher quality than 80% of burgers I eat, unless I make them at home using only the healthiest meats available. Juicy juicy, well-spiced, bursting with sprouts and other vegetables, delish bun. Thick, chunky, gimme-more soup of the day. My dining companions quietly feasted contentedly on all their food. No complaints. And no gas afterward. One thing to note: The orange juice ordered by one us tasted like it had kale and/or other unexpected produce in it. They happily made another one for the table, without prompting. If you want a juice that doesn't taste faintly or more overtly of previous juiced orders, say so upfront so they can maybe run water through the juicer or otherwise take care of your request.   Prices: Less than what you'll pay in the tourist-infested areas of L.V. Reasonable, quite.  Misc: Clean, cheerful restroom. Large booths. Sufficient space between tables. A little bookcase filled with books for kids and adults, sits in the back. Good acoustics; you don't have to shout. Calm, well-behaved peeps visiting this place. In a shopping center. Parking looks like it could get scarce at peak times.   None of us were truly hungry for dessert or anything for quite some time after our meal. No extra caffeine needed. Low-glycemic-index foods with uber-dense kernels of nutrition will do that for you. Flying high for the rest of the day. Seriously. But it was also the gym workout and meditation before breakfast.   Get yourself in here already!!! Family-friendly. You will feel the difference.  We were even lucky to meet and briefly chat with the owner, a smart, nice lady. Peace, ever more success, and expansion wishes to this restaurant dynamo!!!! Xxxooo :-)

9lZRHPTMdphxIwvOBZddsw.text: I've had great experience here before. But yesterday, I ordered a Superfood Quinoa Salad and the black bean salad using their app and to be delivered. I hate to do this, but I'm not thrilled that I paid over $20 and wasn't happy with what I received with the exception of the black bean salad (it was delicious).   1) their website states that if you download the app, you get $5 off your order. Not True. I had to call twice and while the woman I spoke with was incredibly nice and attempted to accommodate me, the $5 code didn't work and I was unable to receive this discount despite the website offering the same. I was offered a free dessert as an accommodation, I declined.  2) I was told my salad wouldn't travel well unless the dressing was on the side (it's supposed to be tossed). I said that was fine, but ended up with not nearly enough dressing to toss myself.   3) My $14 salad was supposed to include the following items which were NOT included: mixed field greens (I got romaine instead), kale, avocado, raisins, and sunflower seeds. Instead I paid $14 for quinoa, romaine, cucumber, broccoli, carrots, cabbage, a few goji berries, walnuts, and sprouts with not nearly enough dressing.   I'm really disappointed. I will eat here again eventually I'm sure (due to the complete lack of vegan options near my office), but I won't order carry out. I feel like I was taken advantage of by being charged $14 for a crappy salad that I could have made myself for less than half that. I ordered the salad because I needed the nutrients and didn't want to spend a bunch of money on things that weren't healthy. Well... I got an awful salad that lacked more than half of the "superfood" ingredients advertised. I know more restaurants completely cheap out in avocado, but seriously? Not to include it at all? Then romaine? This salad sucked and I'm irritated.   However, their food is delicious when made properly. I would recommend eating there or picking up your order so you can verify it is correct before you leave. I would never order delivery from here again.

krIUBnvhVjYpsnwukM2ITQ.text: Finding vegan food can be a challenge. Finding creative, unique and tasty vegan food (other than a salad without meat/dairy or a plate of vegetables) is like Mission Impossible 7. Luckily, there are restaurants that hold higher standards and attempt to set the bar high.  When I left L.A., I left Follow Your Heart. It's not just a brand, it's a market/restaurant that was minutes from my home. It was my safe haven and a place I could enjoy and not fear cross contamination.   Alas, I moved to Las Vegas, only to discover vegetarianism and veganism is growing immensely! After a vegan search on Yelp, I discovered Violette's, and the extensive menu items enticed me so much that I have been back again and again.   Now that I have tried a few menu items, I can honestly say that I have "followed my heart" to Violette's. I love the variety of fresh, organic and delicious vegan food!  My current favorite is their "mac and cheese", teriyaki cauliflower bites, the chocolate cake (love the vanilla icing and would love to try a double chocolate if they ever switch it up) and zucchini zen sticks because that marinara dipping sauce is what life is all about!   This is definitely my new go-to spot!

JourjFO2ju_QK8V0gBTuTQ.text: If you're looking for something filling yet healthy, Violette's is a good place to be. They offer a wide range of dishes, from sandwiches to full entrees, and also have a fresh juice bar! The first time I came here, I had the Violette's Club (double decker club sandwich made with tempeh instead of bacon, and tofu instead of turkey). Today I tried the Sunrise BLT (a BLT with tempeh instead of bacon and vegan mayo on grilled sourdough bread). Both are excellent.   Service is friendly, but do be prepared to wait a bit for your food. I think everything is made to order, so I wouldn't advise coming here if you're in a rush (but they do take-out as well!).   The decor in the restaurant is really cute and creative. I look forward to having lunch here again.

uaupsx5lIgJCgRmYWpxHXA.text: Great service, great menu. We made the trip over all the way from the strip in a cab and it was expensive but totally worth it. Huge menu, still serving breakfast later on in the day and the biscuits and gravy were absolutely amazing. We enjoyed it so much that we left on foot walked around, had a massage and went back again for dinner!  Grilled vegetables are usually just boring grilled vegetables, and as vegans we can tire of them. You have never have vegetables until you have had them here! Oh my! They came with the biscuits and gravy and I just could not believe how delicious they were!  The vibe here is awesome and the food and service are so good that thee wait is totally worth it...which is not nearly as long as some reviews make it seem. Y'all, there are outlets at every table. You have your very own outlet at your table!!!! So when you're ordering nonstop you can charge your device, so you can take pictures of your food! (If you don't excitedly gobble it down, like we did)  Also, what's better than a vegan bracelet winning poker player??? NOTHING. (Except her food) Thank you Cyndy!!!

fPKgFD2a_tPOuHONk1TFjA.text: Had Violettes for the first time this week and it was absolutely delicious! You walk in and definitely feel like you're in a vegan hippie restaurant but don't let that scare you away! We got the backyard BBQ sandwich and the philly, both were super tasty and you'd have no idea you were missing meat. I personally think things are more flavorful when made with a soy or plant based protein. Also their "wings" with buffalo sauce instead of BBQ is a great starter! A tad too greasy for me but tons of flavor! We will definitely be back to try everything else on the menu! It's nice having a reasonably priced, delicious vegan restaurant close to home!

I specifically asked to exclude onions from my plate, but when I got my food it had onions over the top. When I brought it to her attention, she took my plate back. I got my plate back with half cooked noodle, and it tasted nothing like the last time I was there. So if you want under average food, and shitty customer service by all means. I won't be back.

f9HPcbo22UxK26PC_qOkNA.text: With the plethora of eateries in Vegas, violette's stands out as a one of the few vegan places I would go to several times and not get bored of the offerings. Personally I will be coming back for the backyard BBQ sandwich. Oh and don't forget to check in and get your chili!

iGdYh1nH673UflnFNS56hA.text: We visited this establishment on Labor Day weekend 2015. It is cute, clean, and little laid back. One of the staff was a bit uptight but that's probably because she was the only server.  She was real friendly and frazzled juggling 5 other tables. We were surprised that the other woman behind the counter completely disappeared. We ordered our dishes to go and after 20 minutes, she went to the kitchen to find out what was taking so long (before the kitchen door shut, her shouting started).   Everything was packaged very neatly. We ordered Zucchini Zen Sticks, the Philly with French Fries, California Dreamin' Bacon Cheeze Burger with Mac N' Cheeze, and dessert. Mind you this is for two people heading back to Orange County; this is our road trip food to last us thru traffic.  We paid at the counter and the server kept apologizing for the wait. We were not in any hurry but she was kind to acknowledge the wait.   All the food was a delight. We only ate half of everything because we wanted to still have a nice treat of eating it again the next day.

ps98PK8pGGHmT_ne_E7DLg.text: Good food, but way over priced. Service isn't great. Was told to seat myself, and I was not greeted until after I got up and found a menu by the cashier where all servers were standing. $10 for a "large" salad which was not a large by any means... just put in a small bowl. $8 for cauliflower tossed in buffalo sauce. I would understand if I ordered an item that was made with more costly ingredients. Not terribly impressed

dT3SzrpmIgv_VXb6zvd2Kg.text: Definitely a wonderful place to eat & experience. Let me start at the fact that they have beautiful art throughout the restaurant. There is also different books & cards on each table so you can enjoy your meal with some nice art & knowledge. All the workers are very friendly & outgoing! We got to pick where we wanted to sit, also got our menus promptly. The food was amazing & we got free coffee refills! The food was delicious! I would definitely come here again.

NSF3fFzExByd4dB6yVZ-yw.text: I have stopped by Violette's at least 5 times and I would say that the food has been consistent. It is flavorful, colorful, and fresh. I usually get my food to go because I have family that live nearby and I stop by to pick up some healthy vegan food before I am bombarded with junk food.  The smoothies are made fresh and to order. Some of the sweets are outsourced which is fine. I think it is great to promote other vegan businesses. The staff is friendly and do a good job of taking your order quickly and efficiently.  I even pre-ordered a full course meal last Thanksgiving to take with me and it was delicious!  The meals here keep me full and happy. I think even non vegans would enjoy the various breakfast and lunch menu items because they look like the 'real' thing without doing animals harm.

8CJqudTOMLDakxZghxeAaQ.text: First time coming here this afternoon first time eating vegan  the two lady's I talked to were so nice telling me what they liked best, also food was great! But there was this one guy with a blonde Mohock was so rude the whole time I was there he walked around with a stank face didn't even acknowledge me when I walked it and he's even more rude to his coworker to one of the sweet ladies that helped me out he grabbed a bag that had food in it and showed the manager and said 'this doesn't look vegan' and threw it! she replied ' those are mine sorry I got it for my kids ' smh who act as like that in front of customers other than that it was good experience

N30mXlOL9HkhBIyMcxZ9QQ.text: Been there twice, the staff is very good and honest. The food is great. The only downside is the wait time usually pretty long, but the food is worth it in the end. Recommended for anyone vegan or vegetarian! Will definitely come back in the future.

4Kf5cdmBL1iDuQWo125_5A.text: I always go out of my way when visiting Vegas to eat here. Something for everyone, even the non-vegans. Everything has been great and leftovers for the next day. Free soups with checkins and great service. Recommend the nachos to share and chicken dinner if you're hungry.

jyvnDKnUpYxr9UifEszvBQ.text: I had wanted to visit this place for awhile now. So, glad we went as are visitor's from out of town. Food and service were great. I had the california burger. The fries were great. Get the Vegas Sunrise at the juice bar. The service was great and the owner was warm and friendly.

Rmt0jv89JBhcevWppPLudQ.text: This is my new favorite vegan place. I've been here twice now and both times I feel great after I leave. This place gives your body the food it needs to be fully satisfied. Also you get a free soup with your check in!   The staff is always really friendly. They make great recommendations. The first time I got the bacon cheeseburger. I asked for no thousand Island sauce and it came with it anyways but it still tasted delicious so I wasn't too mad. The second time I got the temp a steak sandwich, which was so delicious but a little bit oily. Overall I would get either one again, but I would prefer to try all the items on the menu. Their fries are really good too. They are pretty soft which is what I prefer instead of crispy fries.  I still have yet to try any juices or smoothies, I will totally update this review the more food I try

GenGw72Mjl4xmFhEfHT93A.text: Came here for breakfast with my picky daughter after an intense workout.   I ordered the veggie tofu scramble with cheddar cheez on sourdough bread, which was outstanding. This sandwich does not include any sides, but it's a real steal at only $6.95. For $2.95 I added a side of breakfast potatoes and it included their homemade ketchup that is very tasty. I quickly realized that the sandwich alone was more than enough, but hey...I'm greedy.  My daughter ordered a 4 item combo meal for around $11 or $12. She picked chocolate chip pancakes, potatoes, a sausage patty, and the tofu scramble. The patty was just okay, but the vegan pancake was really really good.   On my next visit, I will explore their lunch menu.

bYzVHcaNU2ItuirkcP_L8g.text: I stopped in here on my way out of town and was so impressed! Everything from the friendly service, cute atmosphere, and amazing food blew me away. The server gave me great recommendations for food and drink. I split the enchilada burrito and Philly cheesesteak with my boyfriend. I recommend add some cheese to the fries that come with the Philly cheesesteak -such a creamy, delicious vegan cheese. Also, I recommend trying the maple iced coffee! Thanks so much for a great experience. I am a visitor of Las Vegas, but I'll be back next time! Please open a Phoenix location

oGCAUKs2YlStIAD8BQRsuA.text: Came here with my friend and our daughters (both toddlers) the staff was wonderful and the food was amazing. I'm from southern ca. We were visiting. I wish we had this place at home! My daughter has food allergies to egg and dairy and her choices are always very limited. She was able to eat anything and it was amazing!!  We love vegan food and this was top notch! She had the pasta with "meat"balls which I chopped up for her and we all shared nachos. I had the pad Thai. So good.

P2baHuR8nOWkdrtCmbHZ8g.text: I've been here a few times... Each time has been a different experience for me... All have been good... With the last being exceptional.   The Decor reminds me of a small cafe by the beach in Carlsbad... It's colorful and calming... Every table has an outlet... Which is perfect if you want to take a working lunch break or study...   The service is pretty good... Lots of friendly smiles. Menus and water are always delivered in a timely manner and the food always comes out quickly.   The food... I've tried the hippie chick burger (flavorful and exceptional... One of my favorite vegan burgers ever)... The nachos (I'm not a nacho person but they were good and full of all the nacho fixens)... the zucchini sticks (definitely good and crunchy but I'm not a fried finger food person), the Mediterranean dinner (amazing! And had everything a girl in the mood for Greek could ask for), the raw wrap (my favorite thing ever! Pesto was on point!!) the salads (all super fresh and crispy and large for sharing)... The black bean salad (I wasn't expecting this to be as good as it was, but it was really great flavorful and savory!)... The buffalo French fries (okay so I had only 1 off my friends plate because if I had any more I knew I wouldn't be able to stop eating them!)   I believe they are currently in the works of getting a beer and wine license which is really exciting for me... I love wine.  They also offer a full smoothie bar... I've tried a few of them.. The blueberry is really good... Tastes like a blue berry muffin... And the coffee one is amazing... I bring my own protein and modify as needed.   Vegans and non vegans... If you haven't been to Violette's you're missing out...

Ah5bgHVDBAtej9-TTOubEQ.text: This was delicious and I will absolutely go back to try something healthier. I have the worst PMS munchie cravings today so I got the nachos, which were a healthy version of traditional nachos and so I don't feel that bad. My server was Jessica. She was fast, friendly and was excited to tell me about the menu. The vibe in the cafe is pleasant too; lovely chi. I really wish this place was in Henderson but I will revisit when I'm over here. :-)   I love this place. I just got the gluten-free fiesta cauliflower and oh my God it is delicious. I will definitely be getting this next time I'm in the area. Please consider opening a location in Henderson, pretty please!

lpPLagY0s3f9x0yGamt5og.text: Food here is always amazing! Definitely my favorite vegan restaurant in Las Vegas. I always order either the loaded potatoes or California burger. They also have some really good chili!

lONpyuRFeZtSqKoMBigfzA.text: Hands down top 5 favorite vegan spots. I was In town visiting and this spot was near where I was staying. I had a craving for Mac n cheese. I almost always order Mac n cheese when I eat out because I'm on a mission to find the best vegan Mac. And this might be it. So good. And the noodles were cooked to perfection. It's not easy to find good vegan Mac so let's just say I was ecstatic to randomly discover this place. I also got nachos. Holy nachos. So good. Every bite was pure deliciousness. Not everyone can do nachos right. They have The layering technique down to a science. The cheese to chip ratio on point. And they use the thicker chip so it doesn't turn soggy in 2 seconds. I'm glad I live on the other coast of the country otherwise I'd eat my way through the entire menu.   Oh. And the service was great. Bravo Violette

JGZbds7jo4wrQC7wgn3R9g.text: Excellent vegan menu off the strip. Two of us shared the cupe of tomato garden soup (loads of veggies!), buffalo cauliflower (tasty but not crispy), the small nachos (cheese sauce was amazing!!), the Philly cheesesteak (good flavor, delicious chewy bread, but not much filling), and the peanut butter shake (checked all of the milkshake boxes). The best part was the chocolate chip cookie (it's HUGE!) - the highlight because we added ice cream and made it into an ice cream sandwich. AMAZING!!! The ice cream was so creamy and perfect, the cookie equally delicious.   Customer service was the best. Our waiter was friendly and so enthusiastic/knowledgeable about the food. Will go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Violette's Vegan Organic Cafe & Juice Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate chip cookie with ice cream added - do it!

O-CbkGUlrvFfoxv2UIgQTQ.text: If you are in the mood for comfort food, look no further. The best roasted sweet potatoes, Mac & cheese, potato salad, black bean salad. It's a menu I intend to work my way through for each entry, juice & smoothie!   Tip #1: save your receipt and get $5 off your next Dine-in meal of $25.   Tip #2: sit at the bar and get the benefit of smelling fresh juices being prepared in front of you.   Life is too short for junk food; eat food that loves you back instead!   The servers are lovely, they make you feel welcome too.  Request to management: please add your juice, shots and smoothies to your Yelp Menu or your website menu so we can choose in advance. I understand somethings won't be available for the PostMates or GrubHub service, but none the less, juice foodies like me want to get my palette going by selecting in advance of my arrival for take out service.   Cheers! See you soon!!!

Gh3B745kQWYDN0pfbw6uZg.text: I've come here a couple times on my work break now, and man, there's a huge difference when I dine in to when I order pickup. The food quality, presentation and service is top-notch. I've had the buffalo battered-tofu sandwich and philly cheesesteak; both were excellent. The staff were all very friendly and quick with my orders and drink refills as well. I've become a Violette's Vegan convert!

zD8wZ1pWGL6EelogTm7FIQ.text: Such great ambience! This 100% vegan restaurant also has great variety on the menu and excellent wait staff. The flavors were delicious and the portion sizes plentiful. Be sure to go for dinner to experience the nightime ambience -- it's so cozy, almost magical! Excellent Chick'n fried "steak" plate! This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas you need to take your carnivore friends or family to, as it will surely win them over to the vegan lifestyle.

Forgot to mention that we also ordered dessert - chocolate brownie which was soo soo good!, chocolate chip cookie which my sister loved and ate most of, and a slice of carrot cake that I brought home for my husband. KIuJ39YeescBIO2xMpVQ1A.text: The only place I trust in Vegas for quality vegan food. Everything is phenomenal from their Philly cheesesteak to the chili cheese fries. Smoothies are excellent. Taz is our server of choice and his service skills are 5 star. I take new people here all the time and they usually don't know its all vegan until I tell them. Too many good things to say about this restaurant. Go check it out for yourself!

dbKhzTWcHWGGWnRo25T3kg.text: This place is GREAT. I've been here just a handful of times, the most recent one being to try their Veganuary menu: Pasta Primavera: Honestly, I wasn't a fan of this. I was expecting long noodles and they were short little ones, the sauce was a little thin, and the flavor wasn't all there. So sad because I was really looking forward to some cream pasta! Sloppy Joe w/mashed potato side: Delish. Hunnie Bunnie liked the Sloppy Joe A LOT. And she loved the mashed potatoes. Super creamy! Fried egg breakfast sandwich w/Mac n cheese side: So good. I kept seeing photos of the fried egg sandwich, and it just didn't look very pleasing to my eye. But it tastes great! Hunnie Bunnie really liked it too! The max n cheese is made with these giant pasta shells and the cheese is ooey gooey. I think the shells may have been slightly overcooked, but they were still good. Hunnie Bunnie also ordered the Strawberry Rosie milkshake. It was SOOOOO good. They asked if she wanted Almond milk or coconut milk. Sooooo daaaaaaamn good. See our Veganuary Mukbang here: youtu.be/5cJR-BPl4mE We also came here for Thanksgiving dinner. It was verrrrrry good, and filling, and plentiful! The only thing I would request is they have their full beverage menu available to order during their special dinners. But I would definitely come back here for Thanksgiving. And it's nice to see everyone who was dining there enjoying a plant based meal for the holiday! Staff is all super nice, and friendly, and the decor at the restaurant is super cute.

LQOyD0GtHJ4isx3PnrWaww.text: I'm not vegan but sometimes it's nice to skip the meat in leu of something healthier, so when a friend asked if I'd go to Violette's with her, I instantly said yes. I'd heard such good things! I was not disappointed.   The restaurant is colorful and vibrant with art on the walls and bright colors. There are booths, tables and bar seating (where you can drool over the delicious looking desserts up close). We sat at a round table in the corner which gave me a good chance to look around and soak up the positive vibes this place has.   We started with an order of Thai fried cauliflower and I have been craving it ever since! The peanut sauce that it's served with is so good and the cauliflower is crisp and tasty without being too greasy. For my meal, I got the Mediterranean Feast which was HUGE. The rice was the only part I didn't love... it was too dry. But the falafel, pita, pickled cabbage, hummus, etc was all really good and flavorful. It was a really refreshing meal.   For dessert, we got a cupcake, a brownie and a donut to go. I only ate the brownie but it was so good. The donuts come from a vegan donut shop in town but I forget the name of it. My friend said both the cupcake and donut were delicious.   I'm planning to go back next week... I need more of that cauliflower in my life!

q-jeUmSi2k46YgCt0v2ryw.text: Just tried this spot, it's really yummy!!! I ordered the fried chicken/mash/corn sooo YUMMY!!! As a take out order, you always wonder if it'll stay hot enough by the time you get home, but the quality of food did not disappointed, very flavorful. I will definitely be coming back!!! YAL04RLLTKOqbBY_wXU_Jw.text: This was our second time trying Violette's, but our first time dining in. (We did Grubhub the first time.) I definitely prefer eating their food at their location vs. takeout, and I'll definitely be back for brunch again.   I got the Rise and Shine plate, and added a fruit cup (bananas, strawberries, and blueberries). It was delicious! It's a tofu scramble with potatoes and steamed vegetables (carrots, broccoli, and cauliflower), and buttered toast, and the fruit cup was fresh and quite hefty! My bf got the California Dreamin' burger -- he's a meat eater and inhaled it immediately! We also got the teriyaki cauliflower bites (yum!!), and blueberry pancakes as a side. The cauliflower bites were plentiful, and the texture was on point. Very flavorful, too! The pancakes were fluffy and filled with plump blueberries. They were delicious!   Everything was prepared and cooked splendidly, and we'll happily return to dine in! :)
